snippet: The military chiefs of 15 West African nations have begun deliberations in Abidjan, Ivory Coast, to “finalize a road map” for an armed intervention in Mali.
abstract: Military chiefs of 15 West African nations have begun deliberations in Abidjan, Ivory Coast, to finalize plans for an armed intervention in Mali, whose northern half is occupied by Islamists linked to Al Qaeda.
lead_paragraph: The military chiefs of 15 West African nations have begun deliberations in Abidjan, Ivory Coast, to “finalize a road map” for an armed intervention in Mali.
